Damaged_Site_Nearby: Historic building of the regional youth center (formerly the Shchors Cinema)
ACLED_Notes: On 27 February 2022, the Russian military forces carried out air strikes and shelled with heavy weaponry the city of Chernihiv, damaging 6 residential buildings, including a children's dental clinic and kindergarten. Russian troops also launched a missile attack on the center of the city. Two Ukrainian soldiers were killed. Also, 16 civilians sustained various degree injuries.

Damaged_Site_Nearby: The Military Historical Museum - a branch of the Chernihiv Historical Museum – Chernihiv
ACLED_Notes: On 13 March 2022, Russian forces throughout the whole day conducted airstrikes and shelled Chernihiv with heavy weapons, hitting residential buildings. One of the shells hit a dormitory. Seven people were rescued, one person died, further casualties unknown.

Damaged_Site_Nearby: Chernihiv Regional Universal Scientific Library. V.G. Korolenko
ACLED_Notes: On 30 March 2022, the Russian forces continued to fire artillery in the direction of Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.

ACLED_Notes: On 7 March 2022, the Russian military forces clashed with Ukrainian forces near Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.

ACLED_Notes: Defusal: On 6 March 2022, Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists found and defused three unexploded Russian FAB-500 aerial bombs at the private house in Chernihiv (Chernihiv). According to local sources, those aerial bombs were left over from downed SU-34 the day before.

ACLED_Notes: On 19 August 2023, Russian forces launched 'Iskander' missile at an opera theatre, where a drone exhibition took place, in Chernihiv. 7 civilians were killed, including a child, and 156 civilians were injured.

ACLED_Notes: On 23 July 2023, Russian forces launched 19 missiles (5 'Onyx', 3 'X-22', 4 'Kalibr', 5 'Iskander-M' and 2 ballistic 'Iskander-M') by submarines and aircrafts at Odesa. Ukrainian air forces shot down 9 Russian missiles (4 'Kalibr' and 5 'Iskander-K'. 11 educational buildings and an Orthodox church of the Moscow Patriarchate were damaged. 1 civilian was killed and 22 civilians were injured.

Damaged_Site_Nearby: Museum of Western and Oriental Art
ACLED_Notes: On 20 July 2023, Russian land forces, navy and kamikaze drones struck an administrative building, House of the Archaeological Museum, the Literature Museum, as well as a kindergarten in Odesa, Odesa. Kalibr-type cruise missile was used during the attack on the historic center of the city. According to Ukrainian forces, the strike involved 38 missiles and unmanned aerial vehicles, 18 of which were destroyed. 1 civilian was killed, 8 civilians were wounded, among them 3 employees of the State emergency service of Ukraine.
